metadata.title: Global and Hemispheric Air Temperature Anomalies
metadata.description:
Measurement Details
global and hemispheric air temperature anomalies. Gridded values. Anomalies are relative to a 1951-1980 reference period.

Publication
Wilson, H and J. Hansen. 1994. Global and hemispheric anomalies from instrumental surface air temperature records. pp. 609-614.  In Boden, T.A., D.P. Kaiser, R.J. Sepanski, and F.W. Stoss (eds.). 1994. Trends'93: A Compendium of Data on Global Change. ORNL/CDIAC-65. Carbon Dioxide Information Analysis Center, Oak Ridge National Laboratory, Oak Ridge, Tennessee.

CDIAC

PSARC_Utility
Global and hemispheric temperature trends are probably of academic interest only - regional summaries are probably more relevant to stock assessment.


As per Robin Brown.. "**** review this - can't find data ***"

[ A TCODE project ]
